name: Paneer Makhani
history: Paneer Makhani, also known as Butter Paneer, is a classic dish from North Indian cuisine. It's a rich and creamy curry made with paneer (Indian cottage cheese) and a tomato-based sauce, popularized by its smooth texture and buttery flavor.
description: Paneer Makhani is a delightful and creamy dish where paneer cubes are simmered in a smooth, buttery, tomato-based gravy. It's seasoned with a blend of aromatic spices, cream, and butter, resulting in a rich and flavorful curry.

ingredients.item: spices (garam masala, red chili powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder)

instructions.title: Prepare Tomato-Onion Base
instructions.description: Heat butter in a pan. SautÃ© onions until translucent. Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft. Blend into a smooth puree once cooled.

instructions.title: Cook the Gravy
instructions.description: In the same pan, pour the tomato-onion puree. Add red chili powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, and garam masala. Cook until the oil separates.

instructions.title: Add Paneer and Cream
instructions.description: Add paneer cubes, salt, and sugar to the gravy. Cook for a few minutes. Add cream and kasuri methi, simmer for another 5 minutes.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the Paneer Makhani hot with naan, roti, or rice.

tips: Use ripe, red tomatoes for a sweeter and richer sauce.
Adjust the spice levels according to your preference.
variations: Add cashew paste for a creamier texture.
For a vegan version, use tofu instead of paneer and plant-based cream.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 3 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a traditional Indian serving bowl.
Garnish with a swirl of cream and a sprinkle of chopped coriander.
